catalogue_raissonne: Murase, Art through a Lifetime, no. 940
creditline: Mary Griggs Burke Collection, Gift of the Mary and Jackson Burke Foundation
description: black lacquered box with mother-of-pearl inlaid flowers and vines; twisted wire design creating swirling tendrils; mother-of-pearl dots along outside edge of box
medium: Black lacquered wood with mother-of-pearl inlay and brass wire
text: Lacquer boxes from the late Joseon period are frequently decorated with floral scrolls like those seen here. The petals and leaves are made of mother-of-pearl inlaid on the black lacquer ground, while the graceful, curvilinear stems are made of twisted wire.
title: Box with floral scrolls
